content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is the implementation of `extract_julia_code` function:

```julia
using Markdown

function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    code_blocks = []
    tokens = Markdown.tokenize(md)
    for token in tokens
        if typeof(token) == Markdown.Code
            push!(code_blocks, String(token.code))
        end
    end
    return join(code_blocks, "\n")
end
```

This function uses the `Markdown` standard library to tokenize the input markdown string. It iterates over each token and checks if its type is `Markdown.Code`. If it is, the code block is pushed onto the `code_blocks` array. Finally, all the code blocks are joined together with a newline character in between.

Please note that you should have `using Markdown` at the start of your script to use the `Markdown.tokenize` function.

Also remember to include the triple backticks (```) before and after the julia code block in your markdown document, which is the convention for marking Julia code blocks in a markdown document.
